abstract: The company, which has hired Daniel W. Dienst as its next chief executive, had losses in broadcasting and publishing, where advertising revenue fell when it cut back its relationship with J. C. Penney.
snippet: The company, which has hired Daniel W. Dienst as its next chief executive, had losses in broadcasting and publishing, where advertising revenue fell when it cut back its relationship with J. C. Penney.
lead_paragraph: Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia posted troubling third-quarter results on Tuesday, largely because of losses in its publishing and broadcasting divisions. That was not surprising. What was unexpected was the company’s acknowledgment that its curtailed relationship with retailer J. C. Penney had significantly hurt advertising revenue of its magazines.

headline.main: Revenue Slides at Martha Stewart Living, Partly From Curbing Ties to J.C. Penney
headline.print_headline: Revenue Slides at Martha Stewart Living, Partly From Curbing Ties to J.C. Penney
